data.text:
The Town Clerk's office is responsible for recording all deed, mortgages, liens, releases, etc. pertaining to property located in the Town of East Greenwich.

Documents & Recordings

All documents presented for recording must be an original or a certified copy. When sending documents by mail, please include a self-addressed stamped envelope to return the originals after being recorded.

Recording for the day ends at 4 p.m. and the office is located at:

Town Hall

2nd Floor

125 Main Street

East Greenwich, RI 02818

Land Evidence recording requirements and fees are provided below.

Copies for a fee may be requested by mail, in-person or on-line EFFECTIVE JUNE 1, 2024! Please use the form below to request copies by mail. Visit us at 125 Main Street, 2nd Floor for assistance in-person. For internet access, see below.

Free Public Internet Access to Land Records

Internet access to land records is provided as a service to the public. A login and password is necessary. First time visitors will be prompted to create an account the first time using the site.

Images of documents are available for viewing and will be watermarked (unofficial copies).

To print documents remotely without a watermark (official copies), save documents to your cart and check out using a credit card.

Copies are $1.50 per page per RIGL 34-13-9. An additional $2.00 is collected per transaction when ordering on-line.

Requests for Certified Copies can only be made by mail or in-person. An additional $3.00 per document is required by law in addition to $1.50 per page.

Recorded Land Indexes are available from 1962 to present. Document images are available from January 2005 (Book 744) to present. Older images are added by staff as time allows.

Recorded Map/Plan Indexes are available from 1962 to present. Map images are available from 2013 (Plan 893) to present.

Contact Elaine Vespia, Deputy Town Clerk, 401-886-8603 with any questions.

THE USE OF DIGITAL CAMERAS, SCANNERS AND CELL PHONES TO CAPTURE IMAGES ARE STRICTLY PROHIBITED.

SPECIAL INSTRUCTIONS FROM DBR

For hotels, realtors, hospitality and real estate transactions.

E-Recordings

Electronic recordings are accepted from CSC Global and Simplifile.

Property Located In More Than One Municipality

Grantors who transfer property located in more than one municipality must allocate the conveyance tax among the municipalities. If the Grantor presents the recorder of deeds with a certified appraisal by a licensed appraiser, setting forth the value of the specific property located in each municipality, then such figures shall be used in determining the conveyance tax.

In the alternative, the tax for each municipality may be allocated in proportion to the assessed value of the real property in each municipality. NOTE: The total assessed value will likely be different from and less than the total consideration. The assessed values are used ONLY to determine the PERCENTAGE RATIO of value, and not the actual value, which is based on the consideration paid.

RIGL 44-25-1 (d) (3)
